ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: A child's mind can adapt to learn from everything, even video games that have no didactic purpose
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: intended to teach, esp in a way that is too determined or eager, and often fixed and unwilling to change

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: liking to argue and disagree, or arguing and disagreeing a lot

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: It would be fallacious to compare America's revolutionary beginnings to the forced regime change in Iraq
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: not correct

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: making continuous, small movements that annoy other people

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: very determined to do what you want without listening to others

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He believes America is still the same hidebound society it was before the 1960's civil rights movement
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: having fixed opinions and ways of doing things and not willing to change or be influenced, esp by new or modern ideas

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: trying to strongly encourage or persuade someone to do sth

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: describing motion beyond the usuall; hyperactive

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you become inured to sth unpleasant, you become familiar with it and able to accept and bear it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: showing little enthusiasm and effort

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He gave a niggardly tip to the cab driver for failing to get him to the airport in time
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: slight in amount, quality, or effort

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: As he became wealthier, he became more parsimonious, ignoring the beggars he had once given money
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: not willing to spend money or to give or use a lot of sth

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I don't wish to be pollyannaish about our company's current turmoil but I know the problems are only temporary
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: unrealistically optimistic

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: We need a bold leader. We are still suffering from years of pusillanimous
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: weak and cowardly; frightened of taking risks

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The children who live in the apartment next to mine are so rambunctious that I'm afraid they will one day crash through the wall
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: full of energy and difficult to control

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I would be remiss if I did not also point out that he is one of the greatest philanthropists in the U.S.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: careless and not doing a duty well enough

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Elected officials should not have to endure scurrilous personal attacks simply because they are in the public eye

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Because of his quiet and self-effacing manner, the guitarist has not always received the accolades he deserves
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: not making yourself noticeable, or not trying to get the attention of other people

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: extremely polite or helpful or showing a lot of respect in a way that is annoying or does not seem sincere

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: nervous and without much confidence

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: someone who is trigger-happy often uses his or her gun, shooting with very little reason

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: relating to or engaging in sexual activity, esp of an illicit or extramarital nature

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: During the recent hurricane disaster, he remained unflappable despite the horrors all around him

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the state when a ship is in a good enough condition to travel safety on the sea

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: having or meeting at a shared border or limit

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: used to refer to sth that you contribute to

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He recommended a lot of seemingly dicey stocks but they all proved to be smart investments
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: slightly dangerous or uncertain

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The jump in oil prices is due to exogenous factors such as speculation rather than supply and demand
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: found or coming from outside sth, for example a system or a person's body or mind

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: not directly connected with or related to sth

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: not changing, or unable to be changed

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: using very few words to express what you mean

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: used to introduce sth that is related to or connected with sth that has just been said

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to completely ignore the opinions, rights, or feelings of others

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Every day after work I stop in at Moe's Tavern and shoot the breeze with friends over a beer or two
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: have a casual conversation

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: As someone who has lived in Houston for 20 years, I take exception to the notion that our city is uncultured. We have one of the best art museums in the country
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to object to something; to feel or express disagreement with or opposition to sth

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I told my little brother that he had better not tell on me or I would tell on him
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to tell someone in authority about the bad behavior or actions of someone else

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Text messages are a great way to touch base with customers and help them with any questions they may have
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to make contact or reconnect with someone briefly

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Every time I crave good Cajun food, I jump in my car and hightail it over to Hamilton's Grill in Baton Rouge
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to leave a place as quickly as possible

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The missile's unique software allows it to home in on a small part of a larger target
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to aim for; to find and give a lot of attention to sth or someone

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The stream winds through the trail and into the mountains playing hide-and-seek with hikers
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: evade or seem to evade someone

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The arresting officer said that I took a swing at him but I didn't know he was a cop at the time
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to try to hit something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Church officials prefer to let priests suspected of sexual abuse quietly resign rather than air their dirty laundry in public
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: make one's problems known

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Our goal is to stay one step ahead of our competitors and beat them to the punch when it comes to new technology
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to do or obtain something before someone else does

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: At work Jack leads a team of 100 people but at home his wife is the one who calls the shots
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: take the initiative in deciding how sth should be done

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I have spent so much money trying to develop a new method of private space travel, but I think it is time to cash in my chips
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to turn in one's chips for their equivalent in money

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: At a time of increasing tight restrictions on tobacco, there is no reason to ease up on other drugs, including alcohol
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: become less sevre towards someone/something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: It will be a long time before financial analysts get a handle on the actual cost of the U.S. subprime problem
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to understand and be able to deal with (something)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The salesman almost had me convinced the old car was a good value until he decided to gild the lily
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you say that someone is gilding the lily, you mean that they are spoiling something that is already beautiful or perfect by trying to improve it or by praising it too highly

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: His latest novel is set in Czecho-slovakia in the late 1960's but it gives short shrift to the intricacies of the country's political crisis
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if someone or sth gets short shrift, they are paid very little attention

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Having cut the interest rate yet again, the Federal Reserve Board has shot its bolt
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to do one's utmost; exhaust one's capabilities

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I can't believe he has the temerity to ask me for money when he already owes me $100
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: excessive confidence or boldness; audacity

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The new book on New Orleans lays bare many of the overlooked factors that led to the Katrina disaster
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to reveal or uncover private information or feelings

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: These reform proposals were left in abeyance because there was not enough money in the budget to pay for them
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if sth is in abeyance, it is not operating or being used at the present time

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: We all agreed to rent a cabin this summer, but everyone else backed out. Since my name was on the contract, I was left in the lurch
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to leave someone without help or protection when it is needed

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: If you do not pay your taxes, the tax office will make an example of you with strict fines and possible jail time
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to punish (a person who has done sth wrong) as a way of warning other people not to do the same thing

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Making a virtue of necessity, Detroit carmakers have finally gotten serious about offering smaller fuel-efficient cars
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to benefit from sth that one is forced to do

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: During the power outage we made do with candlelight, canned food and warm beer
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: manage with the limited or inadequate means available

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Though he was once known as an independent thinker, today he marches in lockstep with the neo-conservative movement
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if two people or things move in lockstep, they are very closely linked and dependent on one another, so that if one changes, the other changes too

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: When reporters began asking the principal about declining scores on state tests, she passed the buck to the school board
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: shift the responsibility for something to someone else

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Rising fuel costs will probably put a brake on any new routes being added to the airline's schedules
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to slow, impede, or stop someone's or something's progress or activities

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: put the cart before the horse
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: She has already chosen a name for her son, but, since she's not ever married yet, that may be putting the cart before the horse
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to do things in the wrong order

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I usually spend the summer traveling through Europe then round off my vacation with a visit to my parents' home in Seattle
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you round off an activity with something, you end the activities by doing something that provides a clear or satisfactory conclusion to it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: She pretends to be nice but if she believes it will help her get ahead she will gladly stab you in the back
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to be unfaithful or disloyal to

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: For all of the successes of the Civil Rights movement, I think America still attacks the deck against African-Americans
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to arrangesomething so that the results are unfair

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: start off on the right foot
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: For my first week of work, I went in an hour early and stayed an hour late. I wanted to start off on the right foot
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: make a good start at something, especially a task or relationship

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Libya, once a pariah of the West, took a giant stride to world respectability when it was elected as a non-permanent member of the influential United Nations Security Council
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: advance considerably, make good progress

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He always takes the high road with his attackers, never allowing them to draw him into an argument
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to follow the course of action which is the most moral or most correct and which is least likely to harm or upset other people

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: House Democrats are trying to tease out a compromise on the new education bill
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to extract (information) with difficulty

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He's only been vice president for a week but that hasn't stopped him from throwing his weight around
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to exercise influence or authority, esp to an excessive degree or in an objectionable manner

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The new CEO demands all executives toe the line with the new corporate responsibility measures
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: accept the authority, policies, or principles of a particular group, esp unwillingly

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Politicians in Washington twiddle their thumbs while the U.S. debt gets larger and larger
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you say that someone is twiddling their thumbs, you mean that they do not have anything to do and are waiting for something to happen

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I would like to point out the problems with the policies of my company but I don't want to be the one to upset the apple cart
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to disrupt a procedure, spoil someone's plans, etc.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Customers in New York readily vote with their feet. If they don't like your store they will happily walk to the one down the block
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: indicate one's disapproval by walking out or emigrating

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: My neighbor always seemed so nice and quiet until the day he went off his rocker and killed his family
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if someone is off their rocker, they are crazy

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: When her husband died, she had to put up a brave front for the sake of her children
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to hide one's true feelings, thoughts, etc.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The car's price was $10,000. I offered $7,000 and after negotiating with the dealer for an hour, we split the difference and I paid $8,500
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: take the averageg of two proposed amounts

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I was certain that Sao Paulo was the capital of Brazil but I stand corrected
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: (formal spoken) used to admit that something you have said is wrong after someone has told you it is wrong

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Though he is pro-immigration, he plans to stand pat on the issue until the campaign is over
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to refuse to change a decision or the way you do sth

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: After his sexist comment was delivered in front of a New York City feminist group, they let him stew in his own juice
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to worry and suffer because of something that one did

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The senator struck a responsive chord with voters whenever he talked about helping the middle class
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if something strikes a chord with you, it makes you feel sympathy or enthusiasm

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The government should take a hard look at what is happening in its public schools
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to think about a problem or issue very carefully in order to find out what is wrong or to find a better way of dealing it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: take A with a grain of salt
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: According to the New York Times, I will lose the election but I take that paper's projections with a grain of salt
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to understand that sth is likely to be untrue or incorrect

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The California State Supreme Court has become a law unto itself, attempting to craft legislation from the bench
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you say that someone is a law unto himself or herself, you mean that they behave in an independent way, ignoring laws, rules, or conventional ways of doing things

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Using her casting vote, she finally broke the congressional stalemate on the technology bill
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: when a committee has given an equal number of votes for and against a proposal, the chairperson can give a casting vote

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The publication of a photograph of their rival company's founder shaking hands with the dictator was grist for their mill
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: anything that someone can use profitably

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: In the U.S. there is no statute of limitations for murder
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if there is a statute of limitations on a legal case such as a crime, people can no longer be accused after a certain period of time has passed

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: a matter of life and death
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: For me, baseball is a matter of life and death
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: something that is extremely important and often involves decisions that will determine whether someone lives or dies

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The police department should be an arrow in the quiver of our city in its search for development
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: one of a number of resources or strategies that can be drawn on or followed

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: His economic plan may be enough to get him elected, but I think it is pie in the sky
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: sth that you hope will happen but is very unlikely to happen

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The Bush administration valued loyalty above everything and, consequently, there were many sacrificial lambs when things went wrong
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: someone or sth that is given to people in authority and is expected to be harmed or destroyed, esp in order to prevent other people or things from being harmed or destroyed

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The media's fear-mongering over terrorism has led to more than one attack on citizens of Middle Eastern ancestry
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the action of deliberately arousing public fear or alarm about a particular issue

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I don't think he can actually do any of the things he proposes. It is all political hocus-pocus
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: tricks used to deceive, or words used to hide what is happening or make it not clear

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The mayor's ties to a right-wing activist group could be used for political mischief-making by his opponents
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the activity of intentionally causing problems for people

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: In terms of lowering wages, these countries are in a race to the bottom
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a situation in which companies compete with each other to reduce costs by paying the lowest wages or giving workers the worst conditions

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The Yankees may seem all-powerful but the chink in their armor is their overconfidence
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you say that someone has a chink in their armour, you mean that they have a small weakeness in their character or in their ideas which makes it easy to harm them

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Everyone talks about rising oil prices but no one wants to discuss the 800-pound gorilla: Saudi Arabia
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: it is an American English expression for a person or organization so powerful that it can act without regard to the rights of others or the law

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Getting Democrats and Republicans to put politics aside for the week-long charity event was no mean feat
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to be a considerably great, difficult, or noteworthy achievement or outcome

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The president of China will have to work closely with his opposite number in India resolve the border conflict
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a member of a system or class who holds relatively the same position as a particular member in a corresponding system or class

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The U.S. must maintain its statut as primus inter pares among other nations
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a first among equals; the senior or representative member of a group

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Because of its history and enormous endowment, Harvard University draws the crème de la crème of young, gifted scholars
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you refer to someone or sth as the crème de la crème, you mean they are the very best person or thing of their kind

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Chinese basketball courts have been a hunting ground for talent scouts ever since the Houston Rockets signed Yao Ming
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a place likely to be a fruitful source of sth desired or sought

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He mentioned September 11 in every speech, no matter what the topic. With his re-election, it looks like all of the breast-beating paid off
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: public or ostentatious expression of guilt, remorse, or sorrow

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Teenagers follow a herd mentality, listening to the same music and wearing the same clothes as their friends
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the tendency of the people in a group to think and behave in ways that conform with others in the group rather than as individuals

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The only restaurant in town is a Chinese restaurant. So if you don't like Chinese food, you cannot eat anything in town. It's a Hobson's choice
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a choice of taking what is available or nothing at all

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: My cousin lives in a house with no plumbing or electricity. Though I am an environmentalist, I don't believe in such self-flagellation
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the act of hitting yourself with a whip as a way to punish yourself or as part of a religious ritual

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I don't have a crystal ball but it's obvious that the days of $60 oil are over
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a transparent glass ball used by someone who says they can discover what will happen to you in the future by looking into it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: If I had a magic wand, I'd use it to solve our energy crisis, but instead it's going to take the commitment of government and the public
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a quick and easy solution

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: We don't know where the drug dealers are getting their weapons from, but they are armed to the teeth
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: carrying many weapons

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: It appears that Microsoft has been meeting with the company to discuss an acquisition but the details of the meeting are shrouded in secrecy
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to be a matter about which very little is known or understood

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: If every song ever recorded became available online for free, the music industry would be dead as doornail
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: completely dead

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: She routinely fills her weekly column with ad hominem attacks on the president
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: (of a criticism, etc.) directed against a person, rather than against what that person says

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Democrats and Republicans are at loggerheads over the healthcare issue
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to strongly disagree (with someone)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: When I went looking for a new TV, I was confounded by all the new technology
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if someone or something confounds you, they make you feel surprised or confused, often by showing you that your opinions or expectations of them were wrong

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Stanley Kubrick raised hackles with many of the people he worked with due to his take-no-prisoners attitude toward filmmaking
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to be aggressively harsh, tough, or relentless (as in pursuing a goal, exploiting an advantage, or expressing criticism)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Given the folly of Iraq, I believe the neo-conservative movement is at its nadir
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: In astronomy, the nadir is the point at which the sun or moon is directly below you, on the other side of the earth (antinom of zenith)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Though he was intelligent and hard-working, he never entered high society because in the 18th century to be born out of wedlock was still in a significant taboo
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if a baby is born in wedlock, it is born while its parents are married. If it is born out of wedlock, it is born at a time when its parents are not married

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: be caught between a rock and a hard place
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: With his bank demanding payment on the loan and his ex-wife demanding alimony, he is caught between a rock and a hard place
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you are caught between a rock and a hard place, you are in a difficult situation where you have to choose betwwen two equally unpleasant courses of action

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I've been working hard to get out of debt for years but I am still behind the eight ball
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: in a bad situation, in a losing position

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: They have been happily married for over 20 years, which is surprising because they are poles apart from each other in terms of personality
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you say that two people or things are poles apart, you mean that they have completely different beliefs, opinions, or qualities

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Now that we're all back in harness, we should focus on doing our best with the new semester
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: people or things who are working in harness are working together in order to achieve a particular aim

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He may be president, but he is not beyond criticism
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: it is possible to be criticized

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: After finishing in last place last year, the team's reputation has been on the rebound since they began a seven game winning streak
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: reacting to or recovering from an unhappy experience, esp the end of a love affair

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Gilmore's tiny local bookstore has been on the ropes ever since the rise of online shopping
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: in state of near collapes or defeat

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: We keep hearing ad nauseam that we shouldn't worry about the coming recession
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: used to refer to the fact that something has been done or repeated so often that it has become annoying or tiresome

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: In the small California town, whites still outnumber minorities by a factor of three
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if sth increases by a factor of 5, 10, 20 etc, it become 5, 10, 20 etc times larger

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: My son hardly ever smiles or laughs except when he is with his friends
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: very rarely

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Central Park was developed in consequence of the need to provide New Yorkers with a place for peace and quiet in the city
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: as a result

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: His economic reforms began to take shape in fits and starts
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: sth that happens in fits and starts or by fits and starts keeps happening and then stopping again

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: In the final analysis, people vote based on how a candidate makes them feel
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: when everything has been considered (used to suggest that a statement expressed the basic truth about a complex situation)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: She's only been rock climbing for three months but she has taken to it like a duck to water
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you take to sth like a duck to water, you discover that you are naturally good at it or that you find it very easy to do

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Though we usually argue over travel plans for hours, this time we made the decision to go to Barbados on the nod
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: by general agreement and without discussion

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: We met in a crowded bar, and pretended not to know each other. I saw next to him and he handed me the briefcase full of money on the sly
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: in a secretive fashion

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: on the spur on the moment
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: They decided to fly to Rome on the spur of the moment, but after they'd booked their ticket they realized they couldn't find a babysitter
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: on impulse; without planning in advance

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I keep out of harm's way by always being home before midnight and never walking the streets alone
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: in a safe place

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: They have grown apart over the course of time, but they are still married
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: as time goes by

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Without further ado, please let me introduce today's lecture
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: without any fuss or delay; immediately

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The company said revenues and operating profits for the third quarter were in line with expectations
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: in alignment or accordance with

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Many people believe a man should not have woman's name, but "Not so fast!", says, Mr. Elizabeth Butler
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: used in speech to say that one disagrees with what someone has said or to tell someone to stop or slow down

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I would like to express my gratitude to you, one and all
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: everyone

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: the debil is in the details
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The key to writing a good novel is not the plot but the characters, he says. The devil is in the details
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the details of a matter are its most problematic aspect

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The plan calls for marble columns but we can't afford the marble; there's the rub
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: said to mean that there is a problem or contradiction which is difficult or impossible to deal with

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I've long operated under the belief that you should never buy food in a bowling alley
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: thinking that something is true

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.word: We have our work cut out for us
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: With six months to go before the election and most of our campaign money spent, we have our work cut out for us
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: if you say that you will have your work cut out to do sth, you mean that it will be a very difficult task

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He seems naive and inexperienced but when push comes to shove, he is the most reliable person I know
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: when one must commit oneself to an action or decision

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: It was just two old friends confabulating
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to have a conversation

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The chicks are expected to fledge in August
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: (of a young bird) to grow feathers and learn to fly

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Overtime, the cancer metastasize to her jaw and lung
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: If cancer cells metastasize, they spread to other parts of the body and cause tumours to grow there

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: I think it unnerved me to be interviewed by so many people
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: to make someone feel less confident and slightly frightened

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He's under the delusion that he will be promoted this year
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: belief in sth that is not true

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: After this disinvestment, the Government's shareholding in the company would come down to 80%
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the act of selling your shares in a company or of stopping putting money into a business or other activity

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: the act of selling off a business or businesses, or of no longer investing money in something
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a campaign to encourage divestment from fossil fuels

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: They were arrested for embezzlement of company funds
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the crime of secretly taking money that is in your care or that belongs to an organization or business you work for

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: One thing that stands out is her exuberance and zest for life
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: the quality of feeling energetic, or the behaviour of someone who feels this way

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: He is reacting to the style of my interlocution, not its content
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: talk between two or more people; conversation; dialogue

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The wood is painted bright red with the pictogram for immortality cut into it in a repeated pattern
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: a picture or symbol that represents a word or phrase

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The experiment yielded anomolous results
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: different from what is usual, or not in agreement with sth else and therefore not satisfactory

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: blushful mists; her blushful beau
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: having a red face from embarrassment or shame or agitation or emotional upset

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: There was evidence of collusive behaviour between the banks
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: acting together secretly or illegally in order to deceive or cheat someone

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: a duplicitous traitor/spy/politician
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: involving duplicity

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: She heard the eerie noise of the wind howling through the trees
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: strange in a frightening and mysterious way

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: An argument broke out and in the ensuing fight, a gun went off
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: happening after something and because of it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: an exoteric account of a philosophical doctrine
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: intended or suitable for people generally, not only for some people

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Her voice was incantatory rather than conversational
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: relating to or having the characteristics of an incantation

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Explanation in social theories can be idiographic or nomothetic
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: giving or enacting laws; based on law; of a science of general or universal laws

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: We denied the opprobrious charges published against us
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: expressing severe criticism and blame

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: Subsequent editions of the book added various prefatory and supplementary materials
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: of, involving, or serving as a preface; introductory

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: At least a quarter of a million people have died in the fighting and the resultant famines
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: caused by the event or situation that you have just mentioned

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.example: The fighting continued unabated throughout the night
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ1.definition: without becoming weaker in strength or force

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Many big cities in the United States, including mine, have rapidly gentrifying neighborhoods. Longtime residents are now struggling to afford to live in their current homes.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to change a place from being a poor area to a richer one, by people of a higher social class moving to live there

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My uncle went cold turkey and quit smoking when his wife had a baby.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: If someone goes cold turkey, they completely and suddenly stop taking a drug or other substance that they depend on

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: When the teenage girl's video went viral, her family started getting phone calls from TV producers.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: used to describe something that quickly becomes very popular or well known by being published on the internet or sent from person to person by email, phone, etc.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I hate people who troll social media sites. They leave negative comments just to hurt others.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to leave an insulting or offensive message on the internet in order to upset someone, or to get attention or cause trouble

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We are not eligible for any of the affordable housing options because our combined income is above the maximum set by the city.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: houses, flats, etc. that can be bought or rented by people who do not earn a lot of money

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I know some people who have quit being anti-vaxxer for the health of their children.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: someone who does not agree with vaccinating people (= giving them injections to prevent disease) and spreads and encourages opinions against vaccines

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: If we accept the idea of cultural appropriation, then, say, Japanese musicians won't be able to play jazz without being criticized for appropriating black music. So I am very skeptical of the idea.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the act of taking or using things from a culture that is not your own, especially without showing that you understand or respect this culture

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: In response to the U.S.-imposed tariffs on Chinese imports, China has enacted its own retaliatory tariffs on American exports, including agricultural products. This has meant a double whammy for farmers who have already suffered crop losses due to natural disasters, such as floods and hurricanes.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a situation when two unpleasant things happen at almost the same time

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Many people think it is a violation of the emoluments clause for foreign dignitaries to stay in hotels owned by President Trump.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: The emoluments clause, also called the foreign emoluments clause, is a provision of the U.S. Constitution (Article I, Section 9, Paragraph 8) that generally prohibits federal officeholders from receiving any gift, payment, or other thing of value from a foreign state or its rulers, officers, or representatives.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Iowa might be in the heart of flyover country, but it is also one of the most important states in any U.S. election.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: parts of the United States which many people only see when they fly over them on journeys to the other coast, but which they would never visit

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Around 3 million LGBTQ people are reported to live in rural America.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: abbreviation for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (or questioning)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: A friend of my wife's runs a restaurant, and he truly believes in the locavore movement.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a person who only eats food that is grown or produced in their local area

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Gun rights proponents claim that allowing open carry will reduce gun violence by increasing deterrence, but I am not so sure about that.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the act of carrying a gun in public in a way that people can see

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We are all aware that the opioid epidemic is a highly intractable problem because it is a result of the confluence of many factors, including high unemployment, lack of educational opportunities, greedy pharmaceutical firms and a dysfunctional political system.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: The opioid epidemic, also referred to as the opioid crisis, is the rapid increase in the overuse, misuse/abuse, and overdose deaths attributed either in part or in whole to the class of drugs called opiates/opioids since the 1990s. It includes the significant medical, social, psychological, demographic and economic consequences of the medical, non-medical, and recreational abuse of these medications.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Some believe that, for the next president, we should look for an intelligent and yet charismatic leader capable of uniting the nation rather than a policy wonk.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: A person who studies or makes political policies, esp one who has a strong enthusiasm for technical details

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Racial profiling, one of the policies most pernicious to the nation, should be abandoned to protect the civil rights of ethnic minorities.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the practice by the police of thinking that people of a particular race or colour will behave in a particular way, especially that they will commit crime

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Some progressive U.S. cities have been striving to protect undocumented immigrants from the power of the federal government, thereby earning the moniker of sanctuary cities.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a city in the US or Canada where illegal immigrants (= people who have moved to live in another country when they do not have the legal right to do this) are not prosecuted

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We have a new baby and have decided to do a staycation this summer.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a holiday that someone spends in their own country or at home, rather than travelling somewhere else

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The stop-and-frisk strategy, first development by the NYPD, has spread throughout the nation and is an integral part of more controversial racial profiling.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the policing practice of stopping a person briefly in order to search them for weapons or prohibited items

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Increasingly, we are subject to biometrics whenever and wherever we need to prove our ID.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the use of detailed information about someone's body, for example the patterns of colour in their eyes, in order to prove who they are

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I hear that some teenage kids prefer getting burner phones because the use of these phones cannot be monitored so easily by their parents.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a mobile phone without a contract, that is typically only used for a short time and then thrown away, for example when you do not want people to have information about you

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We decided against cord cutting because we heard that so many people have done it that the speed and stability of streaming in the area has been negatively affected.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: act or process of canceling a subscription to cable television or to a landline telephone service

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The younger generation, including my son, do not seem to be worried about working in the so-called gig economy.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a way of working that is based on people having temporary jobs or doing separate pieces of work, each paid separately, rather than working for an employer

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We like the fact that nearly every retailer's website offers the option of opt-in consent before collecting or sharing our personal information.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the fact of choosing to take part in an activity, arrangement, etc. rather than being forced to take part

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: As a business person, I never do phubbing because I would definitely be offended if someone did it to me.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the act of ignoring someone you are with and giving attention to your mobile phone instead

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The fact that the term polar vortex has become a household word tells you that the effects of global warming come in multiple forms.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an area of low pressure and cold air that forms near the North or South Pole and is stronger in winter

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: These days, I will not answer my landline phone until the caller starts talking because there are just too many robocalls.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a telephone call made automatically by a computer, giving a recorded message, or the system of using such calls

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I have seen a test of telesurgery on TV. It is a state-of-art technology whereby a doctor can remotely operate on a patient who may be in another city or even another country.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an emerging surgical system that utilizes wireless networking and robotic technology to connect surgeons and patients who are distantly located from one another

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We may call Turkey and the United States frenemies to each other when it comes to the Middle East because their interests coincide on some of the important issues in the region and conflict on others.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a person who pretends to be your friend but is in fact an enemy

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Social media has facilitated isolated individuals with similar thoughts to form their own communities, which in turn isolate themselves from and attack other communities. A case in point is the incel community, whose members are mostly young, white, single heterosexual males.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a member of a group of people on the internet who are unable to find sexual partners despite wanting them, and who express hate towards people whom they blame for this

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: It is a great irony that President Trump, by attacking the Democratic Party's four new outspoken congresswomen, unintentionally created a kumbaya moment for the moderate Democratic leadership, who defended and embraced them.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition:
Meaning : "Come by here" 
When management tries to create camaraderie amongst employees through a group activity, usually involving food and or drink

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The hip-hop artist lost some of his street cred when he was photographed sipping martinis on Martha's Vineyard.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a quality that makes you likely to be accepted by ordinary young people who live in towns and cities because you have the same fashions, styles, interests, culture, or opinions

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: There is an openly non-binary person working in our office. Since we cannot call the person "he" or "she," we just use the employee's first name.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: having a gender identity that is not simply male or female

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: It seems to me that the Democratic presidential candidates have turned the issue of racism into a "woke contest." In other words, the race is now about who is the most minority-oriented candidate.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: adjective derived from African-American Vernacular English (AAVE) meaning "alert to racial prejudice and discrimination"

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Nowadays, men have bromantic relations based on emotional bonds in addition to homosexual ones.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: Something that allows for slight homosexuality between good bros. Such as bro-spooning, dinner and a movie, or heavy bro play fighting

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: At every visit, my veterinarian listens to my dog's heart and lungs and palpates her abdomen for any abnormalities.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to examine something, usually an organ or part of the body, by touching it with the fingers or hands

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Remember those boys trapped in a Thai cave? They gave them a drug, a form of ketamine, and now the drug has recently been approved by the FDA as an antidepressant.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a drug used to reduce feelings of sadness and worry

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Do you know that the first successful appendectomy took place in London in 1735? It was done on an 11-year-old boy after he swallowed a pin and it punctured his appendix.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a medical operation to remove the appendix

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My father has bad kidneys and undergoes daily artificial dialysis, a treatment to filter out and prevent waste, water and salt from building up in the body.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a procedure where a dialysis machine and a special filter called an artificial kidney, or a dialyzer, are used to clean your blood

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The autopsy showed that the man had been killed by a blow to the head.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the act of cutting open and examining a dead body in order to discover the cause of death

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My wife goes to an ayurveda salon every other week. She says they use modern techniques of ayurveda.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an alternative medicine system with historical roots in the Indian subcontinent

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: In testing for cancer, doctors often need to do a biopsy, but it can be invasive.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the process of removing and examining a small amount of tissue from a sick person, in order to discover more about their illness

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My aunt has several cancer doctors, and they all decided to start her on chemotherapy right away.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the treatment of diseases, esp. cancer, using chemicals

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Dermatology is the branch of medicine that deals with problems related to skin, hair and nails.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the scientific study of the skin and its diseases

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: A friend of mine is an obstetrics and gynecology physician, and she has studied a lot about infertility over the years.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the area of medicine that involves the treatment of women's diseases, especially those of the reproductive organs

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Our family doctor told us that she studied advanced obstetrics for a year after she finished her residency because she wanted to learn how to deliver babies.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the area of medicine that deals with pregnancy and the birth of babies

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Most Americans receive cancer treatment close to home, at community hospitals or at community oncology clinics.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the study and treatment of tumours (= masses of cells) in the body

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I haven't seen my nephew for a while because he is the head of the pediatrics department of the hospital and is always busy.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the area of medicine that deals with children

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The victim the police discovered in our neighborhood had no identification on him, and the cause of his death has yet to be found even after a postmortem.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a medical examination of a dead person's body in order to find out the cause of death

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: A doctor who has joined our hospital has nearly two decades of leadership experience in virology.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the scientific study of viruses and the diseases that they cause

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Arthritis is actually not a single disease, so when you say "arthritis," you are referring to many different types of joint pain or joint disease.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a serious condition in which a person's joints (= the places where two bones are connected) become painful, swollen, and stiff

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Generally, you have an astigmatism when your cornea is more curved in one direction than the other.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a fault in the lens of the eye that reduces the quality of sight, especially a fault that stops the eye from focusing

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: When you have an autoimmune disease, your immune system attacks healthy cells in your body by mistake.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a disease in which a person's immune system wrongly attacks its own healthy tissues

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: According to statistics from the Heart Association, approximately 48 percent of the U.S population has some form of cardiovascular disease.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: general term for conditions affecting the heart or blood vessels

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: He told me that his father died from colorectal cancer, which he said was the No.2 cancer killer in the United States.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the development of cancer from the colon or rectum

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The only thing I hate about football games is that the players are almost always exposed to the risk of brain injuries, including concussions.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: temporary damage to the brain caused by a fall or hit on the head or by violent shaking

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My father has COPD and needs oxygen support. That's because the disease makes it difficult for the lungs to remove carbon dioxide, which is very toxic.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease: a lung disease that makes the lungs work less well and lasts for a long time

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Everyone in the United States should be concerned that over 30 million people in the country have diabetes, that is almost 1 in 10!
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a disease in which the body cannot control the level of sugar in the blood

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I read in the newspaper that outbreaks of sth called "acute encephalitis syndrome" are crippling India in the area of public health.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a serious illness caused by an infection that makes the brain swell

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: When German Chancellor Angela Merkel was seen shaking at an official ceremony, my German friend brushed it off as an episode of dehydration.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a sudden short period in which someone suffers the effects of a physical or mental illness

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Hay fever season is about to start, and I'm going to stock up on eyedrops and antihistamine tablets.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an illness like a cold, caused by pollen

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: When we visited the Yucatan Peninsula in the middle of summer, we both had a case of hyperthermia, namely, our body temperature went up dramatically.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an abnormally high body temperature caused by a failure of the heat-regulating mechanisms of the body to deal with the heat coming from the environment

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: You would be wrong if you think myopia is just passed down from parents. Many doctors have attributed cases, in part, to the use of electronic devices, especially among kids.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a condition in which someone cannot clearly see things that are far away

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: This nervous system disorder is causing him to experience blurry vision and paroxysms of vertigo.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a sudden and powerful expression of strong feeling, especially one that you cannot control

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Pneumonia is a kind of lung infection, and it can be treated by antibiotics that target the most common bacteria that cause the illness.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a serious illness in which one or both lungs become red and swollen and filled with liquid

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My daughter often gets viral infections, just like I did when I was a kid.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: any illness you get from a virus

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I have to take my son to the doctor because I'm afraid he might have ADHD.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder: a condition in which someone, especially a child, is often in a state of activity or excitement and unable to direct their attention towards what they are doing

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: When I was taking care of my mother, who had dementia, I often felt as if I had nowhere to turn.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a medical condition that affects especially old people, causing the memory and other mental abilities to gradually become worse, and leading to confused behaviour

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I saw a TV program about a man who used to steal things impulsively ---- a case of kleptomania. He successfully overcame his illness after regularly seeing a psychiatrist specializing in that disorder.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a very strong wish to steal that you cannot control, especially without any need or purpose, usually considered to be a type of mental illness

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: His uncle is a veteran of the Iraq war and has developed PTSD, or post-traumatic stress disorder.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: post-traumatic stress disorder

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The young man shows no guilt at all when manipulating people and has all the signs of a budding sociopath.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a person who is completely unable or unwilling to behave in a way that is acceptable to society

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My doctor told me that the cerebellum is involved in virtually all physical movement, including coordination and balance.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a large part at the back of the brain that controls your muscles, movement, and balance

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I know that strep throat is caused by bacteria, group A streptococcus, but I didn't know that the same bacteria causes a lot of much more dangerous diseases.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a bacterium, many types of which cause disease

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I have a hard time falling asleep. Maybe my sympathetic nervous system is too strong to allow me to sleep.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the part of the nervous system that increases heart rate, blood pressure, breathing rate, and pupil size

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Since I have high systolic pressure, I try to eat blueberries because they say those berries lower blood pressure.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: systolic pressure is the maximum blood pressure during contraction of the ventricles

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My daughter, a biology major, explained telomeres to me by comparing them to the plastic tips at the end of shoelaces, because they are actually the caps at the end of each chromosome, keeping its ends from fraying.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: structure at the end of a chromosome that protects it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: His son was born with a serious respiratory disorder, so he needed the help of a hyperbaric chamber to help him breathe.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: of, relating to, or utilizing greater than normal pressure especially of oxygen

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Our hearts were lightened to hear that some artists in our town volunteered their time and talent to draw pictures on the casts and prosthetic legs of child patients.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: relating to an artificial body part, such as an arm, foot, or tooth, that replaces a missing part

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: By the time he reached the hospital, he had become apoplectic and was no longer responsive.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: extremely and obviously angry

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: If you drink too much coffee, you might get dehydrated because high amounts of caffeine can be diuretic, in other words, causing the body to produce more urine.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a substance that causes an increase in the production of urine

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Aging means that you have an increasing number of senescent cells, forming in many parts of your body.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: becoming old, and therefore in less good condition and less able to function well

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: As my wife is pregnant, I will definitely stop smoking because they say if fathers-to-be are smoking at home, it may raise a baby's risk for congenital heart defects.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: A congenital disease or condition exists at or from birth

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Researchers now believe that the disease is epigenetic, and they are looking for environmental causes.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: relating to changes, especially heritable changes, in the characteristics of a cell or organism that result from altered gene expression or other effects not involving changes to the DNA sequence itself

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: My eye doctor told me that my dry eyes may have been caused by contact lens wear, calling it a case of iatrogenic dry eye.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: (of a disease or problem) caused by medical treatment or by a doctor

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Stem cells that are pluripotent can develop into any cell type.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: A pluripotent cell is able to develop into several different types of cell

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: As an investor, I would welcome corporate buybacks because that would increase the value of stocks I have purchased.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an arrangement in which a business or person sells something, especially shares in companies, and then buys them again according to an agreement

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: It's not good for the future of the economy that too many large companies have been spending money on buybacks and dividends rather than on capital expenditure, like investing in new equipment and research and development.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: oney that a company spends on land, buildings, and equipment that it uses to produce products and provide services

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I totally agree with the analyst who said that U.S. politics is a duopoly between the Democrats and the Republicans with little, if any, space left for third parties.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a situation in which only two companies control all the business in a particular industry

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: As a certified financial planner, I usually advise against investing in IPOs because they are too risky for nonspecialists.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: initial public offering: the first sale of a company's shares to the public

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Some of the big U.S. corporations, like Microsoft and Amazon, have a market capitalization that is larger than the GDP of many middle-size countries.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the total value of a company's shares on a stock market

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: This investment seems too good to be true, and I'm worried it might be just a Ponzi scheme.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a way of deceiving investors (= people who give money to a company hoping to get more back) by using the money they give to pay interest to existing customers rather than investing it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: As the Japanese economy becomes increasingly globalized, there have been several notable cases, successful and ill-fated, of takeover bids where Japanese companies were targeted by activist shareholders from abroad.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition:
: takeover bid
an offer or attempt to take control of a company by buying enough of its shares to do this, or the amount of money offered

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We tend to forget that the current fiat money system works only if people continue to trust their governments.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: a type of currency that is declared legal tender by a government but has no intrinsic or fixed value and is not backed by any tangible asset

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The coexistence of moderate economic growth and low inflation constitutes the so-called Goldilocks economy, which is favored by advanced economies.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an economy that is growing at an even rate and is not at risk of high inflation or recession (= a period when the economy gets smaller)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I will pay for our dinner tonight because you paid last time. That makes it a wash.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: an act of washing something or an instance of being washed

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Normally, when the value of your financial assets rises, you will be more willing to spend more money, thereby helping the economy. That is known as the wealth effect.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: the theory that when the value of assets such as gold, shares, and property rises, people spend more

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: It has been very difficult for developing countries with large populations to shift their developmental focus from a labor-intensive economy toward a capital-intensive economy.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: A capital intensive industry, business, or process needs a lot of money to buy buildings and equipment in order to start operating

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I wonder why some economists continue to have a doom-and-gloom view of the U.S. economy no matter how well it has been performing for the past 10 years.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: describe a pessimistic view

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: A restaurateur I know often complains about high labor costs, including the overtime pay he is required to pay for nonexempt workers.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: without special permission not to do or pay something, especially tax

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Several human rights NGOs have criticized the leader of Myanmar, a recipient of a Nobel Peace Prize, for besmirching the honor of the prize.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to say bad things about someone to influence other people's opinion of them

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Our newspaper aims at introducing you to the things bubbling below the surface that bespeak big change.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to suggest or show

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I just can't buck the feeling that I'm going to lose this election.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to oppose or refuse to go along with something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The company has been buoyed in the stock market by the success of its most recent phone model.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to support something and make it more successful

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: After the customer complained about the burned food, the manager apologized and comped her meal.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to give goods or services to someone without asking for payment

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: As government expands, the space for thought and action that do not comport with government thinking shrinks.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to be in agreement with

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The bird lover doesn't coop up his pet birds, sometimes having 20 or so flying around his house.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to keep someone or something in a closed space

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: By the time the law was passed, it had been almost entirely defanged and was no longer so controversial.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to make someone or something less harmful, so that he, she, or it is no longer dangerous

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Men in business continue to disempower women by speaking down to them and cutting them off when they're speaking.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to take away someone's confidence and feeling of being in control of their life

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: To make salad dressing, you simply put the ingredients in a blender or food processor to get them to emulsify.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: If two liquids emulsify or are emulsified, they combine and become a smooth mixture

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Some jurists who support the death penalty claim that abolishing it is equal to refusing to instantiate justice in law.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to represent or be an example of something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The paper is really plumbing the depths by criticizing a community activist for organizing a trash cleanup just because of his political views.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to reach the lowest point

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: It is understandable that people feel the urge to prettify a politician's legacy upon his or her demise regardless of their political views on the deceased.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to make something pretty

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Some stars called Cepheid variables are known to pulsate. Therefore, you can measure their distances from the earth by the periodic changes in brightness.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to make sounds or movements with a regular rhythm

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: According to the veterinarian, this virus may recrudesce when a horse's immune system is challenged by several factors, including a heavier workload and a change in feed.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to break out or become active again

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The senator focused her speech largely on her achievements and did not segue into her re-election campaign.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to make a transition without interruption from one activity, topic, scene, or part to another

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: That restaurant serves a great meal, but they tend to skimps on the dessert portions.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to not spend enough time or money on something, or not use enough of something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The product development team was subsumed by the product strategy department and given new leadership.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to include something or someone as part of a larger group

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Yesterday, on Route 9, there was a serious crash in which two buses were totaled and the passengers were trapped inside.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to have as a complete amount, or to calculate this

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The U.S. ambassador to the United Nations said the president needs to toughen up enforcement of the sanctions.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to make someone stronger

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The party continues to put forward legislation designed to vitiate the democratic process and the rights of voters.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to destroy or damage something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: As soon as I heard the term "time-share" being bandied about, I knew it was time to leave.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to talk about something without careful consideration

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The U.S. House of Representatives has voted 245 to 182 to countermand the president's emergency declaration regarding the U.S"-Mexican border.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to change an order that has already been given, especially by giving a new order

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: This government regularly tried to cow people so that they may feel reluctant to criticize it in public.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to frighten someone into doing something, using threats or violence

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: This guy has just moved to this town, but he won't deign to be associated with his neighbors.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: To do something unwillingly and in a way that shows that you think you are too important to do it

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The former president and the former first lady said that there were some leaders in this country who demonize those who don't look like them.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to try to make someone or a group of people seem as if they are evil

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Reportedly, physician groups are calling for new taxes on sugary drinks to disincentivize people from purchasing them.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: discourage (a person or course of action) by removing an incentive

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Currently, big insurance companies are trying to disintermediate the marketplace by completely bypassing individual brokers.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: reduce or eliminate the role of (an intermediary)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The late Justice Antonin Scalia often excoriated his liberal colleagues for emphasizing foreign legal precedents in domestic cases.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to write or say that a play, book, political action, etc. is very bad

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Some motorcyclists often flout the traffic rules by speeding and weaving wildly in and out of lanes.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to intentionally not obey a rule, law, or custom

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The novel was about an elderly spinster who was heartbroken to learn that she had been gaslighted by a much younger man who had proposed marriage.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to trick or control someone by making them believe that their memories or beliefs about something are wrong, especially by suggesting that they may be mentally ill

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The presidential candidate's supporters believe that she will not grovel to the corporations that refuse to cut carbon emissions.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to lie facing the ground, esp. in fear, or to behave toward someone in a way that shows that you are small and unimportant and the other person is powerful

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: On the national debate stage, politicians constantly attack their opponents and impugn their motives on nearly every issue, but regular Americans are not so cynical.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to cause people to doubt or not trust someone’s character, honesty, or ability

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The prime minister attempted to jawbone the health minister into resigning.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to talk to someone, especially to try to persuade them to do something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Many people misconstrued the cancellation of its new product as a sign that the company was failing financially.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to form a false understanding of the meaning or intention of something that someone does or says

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The film was panned by critics for its terrible acting and predictable plot.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to criticize something severely

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Once again, the governor shafted the working class by promising to create jobs and then doing nothing as factories closed.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to cheat or trick someone, or to treat someone unfairly

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The customer had been wearing a Rolex, but he stiffed the waiter on the tip.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to not pay someone money that you owe them

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: These dictators suborn our press and blind the eyes of our people.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to persuade someone, for example by offering them money, to commit an illegal act, especially to tell lies in a court of law

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The new trail was built in order to keep hikers and bikers from bushwhacking through the delicate ecosystem of the gorge.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to live or travel in wild or uncultivated country

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: According to the protocol, female members of the royal family are supposed to curtsy when greeting the queen.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: When a girl or woman curtsies, she bends quickly at the knees, with one foot in front of the other, often while holding her skirt, especially to show respect

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Please be forewarned that no help will come even if you have a serious accident, such as breaking your ankle while trying to ford the river on foot.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to cross a river, where it is not deep, on foot or in a vehicle

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Since our skin is our largest organ, we should be careful about which sunscreens to lather on to go outside.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to produce a lather from soap, or to cover something or someone in lather

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: You can also saunter into the wine shop called Tuscan Hills, which boasts lots of limited-production wines from some 20 to 25 wineries.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to walk in a slow and relaxed way

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The APC chieftain urged the two rival national leaders to sheathe their swords in the interest of Nigeria's democracy.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to put something, esp. a knife, in its cover

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The driver had been swigging whiskey for several hours before getting behind the wheel to drive home.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to drink, especially by swallowing large amounts in a series of single actions

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: While other countries' citizens traipse out to the polling stations in hail, rain or heat, voters in Estonia can do it digitally from the comfort of their own homes.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: existing only as an idea, not as something real

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The lawsuit asks for pecuniary damages and attorney's fees.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: relating to money

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I believe the characters in smaller budget films are far more relatable than the superstars in commercial blockbusters.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: that someone can understand or feel sympathy for

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: These online companies do the best they can to keep track of sketchy websites and block them, but new sites open every day.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: not completely safe or not completely honest

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: seeming to be right or true, but really wrong or false

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: To the uninitiated, all whiskeys taste pretty much the same.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: not having knowledge or experience of a particular subject or activity

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: When he realized his love for her was unrequited, he fell into a deep funk.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Perpetrators of domestic violence must receive condign punishment in order to show that such violence will not be tolerated in our society.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: Condign punishment is suitable or right for a particular crime

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: John and Lyle argued for years, but recently it seems like everything is copacetic between them.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: very good or going very well

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The president has put his exiguous diplomatic abilities to the test and failed to accomplish anything.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: very small in size or amount

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Recently, we have seen some hellacious weather here.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: very strong, powerful, or impressive

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The president's hyperbolic tweets give the impression that people seeking to enter the United States at the U.S.-Mexico border are by and large undesirables.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We are speeding toward the precipice of irrevocable climatic devastation.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Although he is the mayor of New York, the most populous city in the U.S., his national stature is Lilliputian.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: extremely small

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Our state is middling when it comes to the percentage of single-mother families in poverty.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: medium or average; neither very good nor very bad

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: His multifarious career - director, actor, artist, photographer and author - has been unaffected by convention and unmoved by the swaying vagaries of the American public.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: of many different types

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: In the midst of the great national debate about drug prices, this new medicine exemplifies both the good news, namely, saving people from a horrific disease, and the bad news, stratospheric prices.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Because I never know what I'll need each day, my handbag contains a great number of sundry items.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: several different; various

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Life without a cellphone is almost unfathomable for most young people today.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: impossible to understand

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: We only conduct a decennial census because of the difficulty and expense it takes to do it properly.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: happening every ten years

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The study of artificial intelligence is still a nascent science and not nearly as advanced as fiction would have us believe.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: only recently formed or started, but likely to grow larger quickly

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Before this country was settled by Europeans, the eastern half of it was all primeval forest.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: ancient; existing at or from a very early time

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The idea that Marie Antoinette said, "Let them eat cake!" is purely apocryphal.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: An apocryphal story is probably not true although it is often told and believed by some people to have happened

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Everyone in the media acknowledges that the polls leading up to elections are claptrap and should be ignored.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: silly talk that means nothing and should not be believed

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Her poetry has a brief and lapidary style that makes it ideal for posting on social networks.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: clever but simple

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: He has played with the rock group for more than 25 years and was noncommittal when asked which song he wanted to perform most.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: not expressing an opinion or decision

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Thanks to social media, we now live in a postlapsarian age: We have fallen from pre-social media reticence to uninhibited exhibitionism.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: of, relating to, or characteristic of the time or state after the fall of humankind described in the Bible

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Some politicians cannot tell when they have crossed the line between being responsive and being unctuous, to the voters.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: unctuous people or behaviour expresses too much praise, interest, friendliness, etc., in a way that is false and unpleasant

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The discussions rather quickly went from calm disagreement to vituperative accusations.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: describe criticism that's so sharp it hurts

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Many studies have shown the therapeutic effects of pet ownership.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: relating to the curing of a disease or medical condition

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Going from clerk to upper management can be a vertiginous climb for women in many workplaces.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: causing or experiencing the feeling that everything is spinning around

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: There were opportunities galore to identify beforehand the white supremacist who attacked a synagogue in the city.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: in great amounts or numbers

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: China has charged the Australian writer of Chinese origin with espionage, but the charges is patently ludicrous.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: in a way that is clear

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: They sat watching raptly as the boxers started the round.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: If you watch or listen raptly, you give something your complete attention

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: His second novel gets bogged down in long, detailed descriptions of local neighborhoods.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to prevent someone or something from moving on or progressing

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Entrepreneurs rarely break even in their first year, let alone make a profit.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to earn enough money to pay for expenses, without any profit

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Polls suggest that the party will get a drubbing in next month's local elections.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to be badly beaten

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: A new stoplight system went haywire on monday, causing all lights to stay red for 15 minutes.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to stop working correctly

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Shortly before the election, the office was in so much chaos that their campaign strategy simply went poof.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: All of our attention spans have gone to hell in the handbasket since the invention of social media.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The body will lie in repose on Saturday so that friends and loved ones can come pay their respects.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: If you're going to lead this committee, I want you to buy a better suit so that you can look the part.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to look suitable for a particular situation

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Understanding this artist's work pivots on understanding the political conflict in Sri Lanka.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: The meaning is to be based on (something)

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The speaker strongly called out the president on his failed policy.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to criticize someone or ask them to explain their actions

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: He hasn't complained yet, but don't conflate his silence with agreement.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: combine or blend together

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The election results are out and already the opposition is crying foul.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: I live in New England, where the winters do a number on your skin and you are constantly in a battle to keep hydrated.
ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to injure someone or something, or to hurt or embarrass someone

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Carl doesn't have a dog in the fight, so I think I can trust him to tell me if I'm doing the right thing.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.definition: to praise someone or something

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Over the years, large companies have increasingly adopted the feminist narrative, trying to glom onto this sociocultural movement.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The U.S. government has held the tariffs in abeyance pending the outcome of the ongoing trade talks.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: If I wish to place a wager on the Kentucky Derby, there are plenty of online options.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: The wealthy family used their earnings to weasel their way into various charity foundations by donating large amounts of money to them.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Onlookers breathed a sigh of relief as the child was rescued from the rooftop.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Corporations are finally beginning to cotton on to the importance of employees' emotional welfare as a component of their productivity.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: For many Americans, it goes against the grain to withhold their true feelings when talking with other people.

ﾌﾟﾚﾐｱﾑ2.example: Every time the Democratic candidate releases a new policy, her supporters go bonkers.

an everyday routine
